abstract: Analysis by economist Abigail Wozniak and Federal Reserve Board economists finds that dynamism in labor market has dropped 10 to 15 percent between 1980 and 2013, reinforcing concern over lack of mobility in American workforce; question of why fewer Americans are relocating in search of opportunity is more complicated than it initially seems, as recession and mortgage crisis do not account for steep decline.

headline.main: Fewer Americans Strike Out for New Jobs, Crimping the Recovery

snippet: Economists have become increasingly worried that a slide in job turnover and relocation rates is undermining the economy’s dynamism.
lead_paragraph: Economists have become increasingly worried that a slide in job turnover and relocation rates is undermining the economy’s dynamism.
